subject: Re: Runnable JAR, creating separate main()
msgSnippet: I don t think it s really a JAVA question. I guess what I m really asking is what goes goes in the class that has the main? I ve been reading the FAQ but I m
messageBody:
I don't think it's really a JAVA question.
I guess what I'm really asking is 'what goes goes in the class that has the main?'

I've been reading the FAQ but I'm really confused.
I've tried

public class RunnableEM {

public static Test suite() {

public static void main(String[] args) {
Test adaptedTest = new JUnit4TestAdapter(ChromeEM.class);
TestRunner.run(adaptedTest);
}
}

which works, but it's not the right way since the adapter is for junit3 cases?


I also tried

public class RunnableEM {

public static Test suite() {
return new TestSuite(ChromeEM.class);
}

public static void main(String args[]) {
junit.textui.TestRunner.run(suite());
}
}

but I can't see anything happen when I run the JAR.



--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, Joakim Ohlrogge <joakim.ohlrogge@...> wrote:
>
> You need a main class and point to the main class in the manifest.
> If your class has dependencies those need to be listed in the manifests
> classpath.
>
> The first hit on google when you search for runnable jar gives the details
> in a no nonsense form
>
> This is not really a JUnit question but more general java.
>
> HTH
> -----------------------------------------------------
> Blog: johlrogge.wordpress.com
> Twitter: @johlrogge
> E-mail: joakim.ohlrogge@...
>
>
> On Tue, Oct 18, 2011 at 12:19 AM, JohnS <keltix@...> wrote:
>
> > **
> >
> >
> > I'm trying to create a runnable JAR in eclipse using Junit 4.9 but I
> > can't get it right.
> >
> > This website says it is necessary to create a separate class 'main'
> > http://www.javahotchocolate.com/tutorials/jars-and-wars.html#junit
> >
> > I contacted him and he says to try something like this:
> >
> > package packege_name;
> >
> > import junit.textui.TestRunner;
> >
> > public class RunnableTest {
> > public static void main(String[] args) {
> >
> > junit.textui.TestRunner.run(TestCase.class); // separate
> >
> > }
> > }
> >
> > But I get an error for 'run'.
> > Am I forgetting to import something?
> > Exporting the above code creates a 3MB JAR but it does nothing when I
> > click it.
> >
> > any ideas?
> >
> >
> >
>
>
> [Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
>
